title.narrative: ADR entrenched as a mechanism for resolving legal disputes and human rights complaints

description.narrative: Article 252 of the Constitution of Kenya as read with the KNCHR Act empowers the Commission to employ alternative methods of dispute resolution including mediation, negotiation and conciliation. Through the project, the commission applies and promoted the use of Alternative Dispute Resolution (ADR) by other actors.

title.narrative: Systemic human rights violations resolved through Public Interest Litigation (PIL)

description.narrative: Public Interest Litigation (PIL) is one of the means by which the Commission is able to influence policy direction and interpretation of the Constitution through the judicial process. It also serves as a mechanism for the resolving human rights violations. The Commission participates in PIL through either originating petitions in its own name or joining existing petitions filed by other parties which have a major public interest component either as amicus curiae or an interested party as appropriate.

location.ref: High Court in Nakuru and Chief Magistrate's Court in Isiolo

comment.narrative: The KNCHR attended the High Court in Nakuru on invitation by the Court to consider joinder and participation in a Petition challenging denial of remission to persons convicted of robbery with violence. The KNCHR attended to a judicial inquest at Isiolo Law Courts and represented the family of the deceased victim

title.narrative: Intersex Persons Implementation Coordination Committee (IPICC) Strengthened

description.narrative: The Commission was represented in The Task force on Policy, Legal, Institutional and Administrative Reforms regarding Intersex Persons . Notably, the Task force completed its report, launched and submitted the same to the Hon AG. To support the implementation of the recommendations, the Hon Attorney General established the Intersex Implementation Coordination Committee (IPICC) to oversee the implementation of the recommendations in the report. The Commission is both Chair and Secretariat of the committee.
The number of activities implemented over the total activities planned on IPICC support.

comment.narrative: None of the IPICC activities was implemented during the quarter.

title.narrative: Improved access to and timely processing of human rights complaints, with particular attention to SGBV cases

description.narrative: The KNCHR in line with its statutory and constitutional mandate receive and process complaints on alleged human rights violations. Complaints that fall within the KNCHR’s mandate are subjected to further analysis and follow up that includes among others investigations. Complaints that fall outside the KNCHR’s mandate are referred to relevant complaints handling institutions for further action.

comment.narrative: The KNCHR jointly with its referral partners conducted two (2) public forums/legal aid clinic at Wajir and Moyale. During the said forums, the KNCHR received and processed 47 complaints on alleged human rights violations.

title.narrative: A victim-centered human rights based approach (HRBA) integrated in the delivery of justice

description.narrative: This project grant will aim to intensify the advocacy for Human Rights Based Approach (HRBA) in delivery of justice. In doing so, the National Commission is to adopt the following approaches: Capacity building of justice actors; trial observations & targeted court observations; strengthening the legal capacity for persons with disabilities and advocacy for establishment and actualization of reparations mechanism.

comment.narrative: Training of 50 Judges and magistrates and 50 members of CUCs

33 members of Court Users Committes (CUC) from Kitui were trained on human rights, decriminalization of petty offences, case management of SGBV and the role of KNCHR in advocacy for the children accompanying mothers in prisons and access to justice

title.narrative: Strengthened institutional capacity for project implementation

description.narrative: Through the project, the commission will ensure efficient and effective utilization of resources, accountability, effective monitoring and evaluation of the entire process. The National Commission will also work towards strengthening its Human Resources; leveraging on Information and Communication Technology (ICT), strengthen internal policies, systems and processes for effective service delivery.
